----- Original Message -----
From: rsale515@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 08, 2002 10:12 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Heaven, hell & Hitler


In a message dated 8/8/2002 4:04:52 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
llindsey3@... writes:
> christians were responsible for more deaths than that [50,000,000]


Dear LLL,

You have to be out of your mind. Hopefully unschooling for you isn't
tantamount to no-learning.

This list is currently expending a hell of a lot of energy taking a guy to
task who has real problems with modern government. (Ned, funny how
California's R4 filers today received a note telling them that they can no
longer claim private school status and must stop homeschooling, unless it is
through the state. Keep up the good work.)

People are talking about having their feelings hurt and such, because they
hold gentler views about the state and its education than he does, and he
doesn't seem to want to let it drop. Fine. Let's move on. But you come along
with a statement that only an ignoramus could make, and not one peep from
anyone at this list.

Your figures are asinine. Regardless, one murder in the name of Jesus is one
too many. But the interesting thing is that Christianity has a paradigm with
which people as yourself can use to see if its adherents are measuring up.
Read the Sermon on the Mount (you might call it "doing some research."
Interesting concept, eh?), and if ever you see a Christian not living up to
it, you can be sure that it is the Christian -- not Christianity -- that is
at fault.

So lets get to some of those undeniable secular figures. In THE LAST CENTURY
ALONE, atheists have killed: 54 million in the Soviet Union; 35 million in
China; 1.5 million in Cambodia.

Der Fuhrer openly hated Christianity (and there is evidence that he
surrounded himself with occultists). The number he's responsible for? I'll go
with the conservative but common figure of 6,000,000 (no offense to Mr. and
Mrs. Altman).

Spare us, next time, the truly insulting and ignorant claims.

Bob Sale


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]



If you have questions, concerns or problems with this list, please email the Moderator, Joyce Fetteroll, at fetteroll@...

Unschooling-dotcom-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Heaven, hell & Hitler
messages.msgSnippet: Bonnie, I agree with you. I m not arguing any differently! I just consider death from a War to be slightly (not much) different than killing people simply
messages.messageBody:
Bonnie, I agree with you. I'm not arguing any differently!
I just consider death from a War to be slightly (not much) different than
killing people simply because of their religion/sexuality/ethnicity/physical
disability.
The deaths from War happen in ANY war.
Systematic extermination of an entire "race" (of which I am well aware that
Judaism is not a race) IS in my opinion different and that was simply my
first thought when I typed.
~Elissa Cleaveland
"It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction
have
not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Heaven, hell & Hitler
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/9/2002 4:45:33 AM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Elissa, You re right, my mistake. While writing the above I was concentrating on not
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/9/2002 4:45:33 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
ElissaJC@... writes:
> The number he's responsible for? I'll go
> with the conservative but common figure of 6,000,000 (no offense to Mr. and
> Mrs. Altman).
>
> It was 6 M JEWS, 12 million people. If you are going to flame someone about
> they're own stats, get yours right at the same time.

Elissa,

You're right, my mistake. While writing the above I was concentrating on not
offending the Altmans and thus had in mind *JEWISH* victims. Rummel puts the
*total* victims in the camps at around 20,000,000 if I remember correctly.
(His book Death by Government)

Bob Sale


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Heaven, hell & Hitler
messages.msgSnippet: Well, I indicated from the beginning that I was counting everyone. Hitler didn t just inter people in camps, he caused a war.  He killed people from Russian to
messages.messageBody:
Well, I indicated from the beginning that I was counting everyone. Hitler
didn't just inter people in camps, he caused a war. He killed people from
Russian to Africa. he was a monster.

-----Original Message-----
From: ElissaJC@... [SMTP:ElissaJC@...]
Sent: Friday, August 09, 2002 7:50 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Heaven, hell & Hitler

12 M people? Are you counting all the russians, french, and others he
killed? All the uprooted lives?

No I wasn't, I was thinking more in the vein of systematic killing in labor
camps and death camps. That's why I asked further of Debbie re: her
44,000,000
I was never ignoring the dead from War, I just was focused on those who
were
murdered specifically due to their ethnicicity/differences.
~Elissa Cleaveland
"It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction
have
not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein

There is nothing wrong with nationalism. Hitler was crazy. He was not
after nationalism, he was after arranging the world to fit his personal
fantasy.

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Heaven, hell & Hitler
messages.msgSnippet: He killed 6,000,000 JEWS. But he is still responsible for the deaths of another 44,000,000 people.  WE are Jewish, and believe me I think it is bad enough that
messages.messageBody:
He killed 6,000,000 JEWS. But he is still responsible for the deaths of
another 44,000,000 people. WE are Jewish, and believe me I think it is bad
enough that he killed 6 million Jews. But the fact is that he ruined the
lives of many Non-Jews, be they Christian or otherwise. He is the single
most terrible person to ever walk the face of the earth.

Bonnie

-----Original Message-----
From: rsale515@... [SMTP:rsale515@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 08, 2002 10:13 PM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Heaven, hell & Hitler

In a message dated 8/8/2002 4:04:52 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
llindsey3@... writes:
> christians were responsible for more deaths than that [50,000,000]


Dear LLL,

You have to be out of your mind. Hopefully unschooling for you isn't
tantamount to no-learning.

This list is currently expending a hell of a lot of energy taking a guy to
task who has real problems with modern government. (Ned, funny how
California's R4 filers today received a note telling them that they can no
longer claim private school status and must stop homeschooling, unless it
is
through the state. Keep up the good work.)

People are talking about having their feelings hurt and such, because they
hold gentler views about the state and its education than he does, and he
doesn't seem to want to let it drop. Fine. Let's move on. But you come
along
with a statement that only an ignoramus could make, and not one peep from
anyone at this list.

Your figures are asinine. Regardless, one murder in the name of Jesus is
one
too many. But the interesting thing is that Christianity has a paradigm
with
which people as yourself can use to see if its adherents are measuring up.
Read the Sermon on the Mount (you might call it "doing some research."
Interesting concept, eh?), and if ever you see a Christian not living up to
it, you can be sure that it is the Christian -- not Christianity -- that is
at fault.

So lets get to some of those undeniable secular figures. In THE LAST
CENTURY
ALONE, atheists have killed: 54 million in the Soviet Union; 35 million in
China; 1.5 million in Cambodia.

Der Fuhrer openly hated Christianity (and there is evidence that he
surrounded himself with occultists). The number he's responsible for? I'll
go
with the conservative but common figure of 6,000,000 (no offense to Mr. and
Mrs. Altman).

Spare us, next time, the truly insulting and ignorant claims.

Bob Sale

messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/8/02 9:47:32 PM, rsale515@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/8/02 9:47:32 PM, rsale515@... writes:

<< Based on the quotes of mine that you highlighted, maybe you're troubled by
my
use of the words "asinine" and "ignoramus." >>

I think they're way too insulting for this list.

<< I've yet to find -- anywhere
reputable, but god knows where some folks get their information -- the claim
that Christians have murdered over 50,000,000 people throughout their 2,000
year history.>>

Maybe so, but did Jesus say you should come and call someone an ignoramus?

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Heaven, hell & Hitler
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/8/2002 8:33:48 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Debi, Based on the quotes of mine that you highlighted, maybe you re troubled by my use of
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/8/2002 8:33:48 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
debiwatson@... writes:
> Back at you, baby!

Debi,

Based on the quotes of mine that you highlighted, maybe you're troubled by my
use of the words "asinine" and "ignoramus." Last I checked, they were common
adjectives found in most dictionaries. I've yet to find -- anywhere
reputable, but god knows where some folks get their information -- the claim
that Christians have murdered over 50,000,000 people throughout their 2,000
year history.

Bob


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
Dear Debi,

What is it in my post you're denying? I'm a Hitler or a resident of Hell
because I take issue with someone who makes a clearly insulting (and
dishonest) claim about Christians?

Bob

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Heaven, hell & Hitler
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Bob:  Interesting subject line in light of your post.  As you are clearly not the first of the three, which of the second two do you profess to be?
messages.messageBody:
Dear Bob: Interesting subject line in light of your post. As you are clearly not the first of the three, which of the second two do you profess to be? Interestedly, Debi
>>You have to be out of your mind. Hopefully unschooling for you isn't
tantamount to no-learning.(snip)
>>you come along
with a statement that only an ignoramus could make, >>Your figures are asinine. (snip)
Spare us, next time, the truly insulting and ignorant claims.

Back at you, baby!

messages.subject: Heaven, hell & Hitler
messages.messageBody:
<< have you ever wondered if hitler may have
asked for forgiveness,been forgiven and will be w/ all of you in heaven?i
have.by the way-hitler was austrian >>

'm'kay

I'm not going to Heaven if you think there's any chance Hitler's there.
It's not his massive prejudices and the genocide that I see as his primary
sin. It's the hypocrisy, if the biographers are telling the truth that his
own best buddies were all seriously "flawed" biologically. And unless he
dyed his hair, he wouldn't be admitted into Aryan Nation or any of todays
"ooh let's be like Hitler" boys' clubs.

If Hitler can gain eternal paradise by saying "oooh, sorry God" at the last
minute, then my neighbor Helen Carter, the sweetest woman I have ever met, is
burning in hell for that same doctrine. Because she was Catholic and thought
that all Protestants should just be Catholic too because it was the right way
to worship Jesus.

Hell is a really stupid idea. I wouldn't worship anyone who would come up
with an eternal fiery pit. But we could talk about where the ideas about
hell were borrowed (to go with that Mardi Gras history), and how many
cultures believe that and have similar names for it.

I wouldn't even wish an eternal fiery pit on Hitler.

Sandra
